Title.evidence: Methods: This clinical trial aimed to examine the effect of a personalized pain education and management intervention

Trial_Design.evidence: Between February 2021 and September 2022, 212 patients were randomized

Participants.evidence: Most participants in the final sample of 129 identified as Black (73% [94 of 129]) and women (56% [72 of 129])

Intervention.evidence: Patients randomized to the intervention worked with the paraprofessional coaches throughout hospitalization

Objective.evidence: Questions/purposes: Does personalized pain education and management delivered by coaches

Method_Outcome.evidence: Surveys included average pain intensity scores over the past 24 hours measured on the pain numeric rating scale

Number_Randomised.evidence: 212 patients were randomized to the intervention (49% [104]) or control group (51% [108])

Number_Analysed.evidence: leaving 69% (72 of 104) and 53% (57 of 108) for analysis in the intervention and control group, respectively
